Race.SpecificTitle: PW Police Jury (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizes an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption be authorized in the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption shall extend and apply to property in Union Parish only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of Union Parish voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PJ (Council on Aging) -- 1.63 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Millage Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, 1.63 mills property tax continuation for administering, maintaining and supporting services, programs and facilities of the Union Parish Council on Aging.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy a tax of one and sixty-three (1.63) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish (an estimated $282,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of administering, maintaining and supporting services, programs and facilities of the Union Parish Council on Aging, said millage to represent a thirteen hundredths of a mill (.13) increase over the 1.5 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2012 pursuant to an election held on October 4, 2003?

Race.SpecificTitle: HospServDist#1, Wds. 3, 4 & 10 -- 5.34 Mills renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Hospital Service District No. 1 Proposition
(Wards 3, 4 and 10)
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 5.34 mills ad valorem tax renewal for operations and maintenance of the hospital for the care of persons suffering from illnesses or disabilities which require care in Wards 3, 4 and 10, Hospital Service District No. 1.
Race.FullText: Shall Wards 3, 4 and 10, Hospital Service District No. 1 of the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy a tax of 5.34 mills on all property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $118,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012 and ending with the year 2021, for operations and maintenance of the hospital for the care of persons suffering from illnesses or disabilities which require care in the District?

Race.SpecificTitle: Northeast Union Fire District -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Northeast Union Fire District Proposition
(Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 10 mills property tax renewal for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for Northeast Union Fire District and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall Northeast Union Fire District, Union Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of ten (10) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $36,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and/or operating fire protection facilities and equipment in and for the District and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sadie-Tiger Bend FPD -- $75 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sadie-Tiger Bend Fire Protection District Proposition
(Parcel Fee)
 
Summary:  10 year, $75.00 parcel fee for Sadie-Tiger Bend Fire Protection District of the Parish of Union for acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and all purposes incidental thereto.
Race.FullText: Shall Sadie-Tiger Bend Fire Protection District of the Parish of Union, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect annually for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2012, a fee of Seventy-Five Dollars ($75.00) on each lot, subdivided portion of ground or individual tract upon which is located, either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of the structure's being occupied or unoccupied (an estimated $24,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year), for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities for the District, including the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes and all purposes incidental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Spencer-West Sterlington FPD -- $40 Serv. Charge - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Spencer-West Sterlington Fire Protection District Proposition
(Service Charge Continuation)

Summary:  10 year, $40 annual service charge continuation on each residential or commercial structure in Spencer-West Sterlington Fire Protection District, for acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating fire protection facilities, vehicles and equipment, including both movable and immovable property, that are to be used to provide fire protection for said District.
Race.FullText: Shall Spencer-West Sterlington Fire Protection District, Union Parish, Louisiana (the "District"), acting under the authority of La. R.S. 40:1502.1 and other constitutional and statutory authority, levy and collect an annual service charge of Forty Dollars ($40) on each residential or commercial structure located wholly or partly in the District, whether occupied or unoccupied, for an additional period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2011 and ending with the year 2020 (an estimated $14,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of said service charge for an entire year), inclusive, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining or operating fire protection facilities, vehicles and equipment, including both movable and immovable property, that are to be used to provide fire protection for the District?
